column1: Ability to safely receive investigational and SOC regimens
Absence of identifiable primary tumor or nodal disease
CT chest with IV contrast or PET/CT
Centrally located primary tumor <2 cm from nodal disease (overlap risk)
Identified primary tumor and at least one nodal metastasis
Metastatic or locally recurrent gastro-oesophageal cancer
No evidence of distant metastases (by FDG PET/CT)
Pathologically proven non-operable stage IIB or III, node positive NSCLC
Pleural fluid cytology if effusion visible on CT and x-ray
Separate tumor nodules in same lobe
